forecast-period.text: A surface trough stretches from the Central West coast, across the southern Gascoyne and into the Interior of the State with a ridge of high pressure well south of the State. The trough near the west coast will move eastwards during Monday afternoon. A ridge of high pressure will develop near the southwest of the State on Tuesday.
For latest warnings go to www.bom.gov.au, subscribe to RSS feeds, call 1300-659-213* or listen for warnings on relevant TV and radio broadcasts.
* Calls to 1300 numbers cost around 27.5c incl. GST, higher from mobiles or public phones.
Partly cloudy. The chance of a thunderstorm in the west. Winds easterly 20 to 30 km/h.

Partly cloudy. Very high (90%) chance of showers in the north, medium (60%) chance elsewhere. The chance of a thunderstorm in the morning and afternoon. Heavy falls exceeding 50 mm possible inland. Winds easterly 20 to 30 km/h. Overnight temperatures falling to around 16 with daytime temperatures reaching the low to mid 20s.
UV Alert from 8:10 am to 2:50 pm, UV Index predicted to reach 9 [Very High]

Partly cloudy. Slight (30%) chance of a shower in the late afternoon and evening. The chance of a thunderstorm in the afternoon and evening. Winds easterly 15 to 20 km/h becoming light before dawn then becoming easterly 15 to 25 km/h early in the morning. Overnight temperatures falling to around 18 with daytime temperatures reaching around 30.

Partly cloudy. Medium (40%) chance of showers, clearing in the late afternoon. The chance of a thunderstorm in the morning and afternoon. Light winds becoming south to southeasterly 15 to 25 km/h during the morning then becoming light during the evening. Overnight temperatures falling to the low 20s with daytime temperatures reaching the mid to high 20s.

Partly cloudy. Slight (20%) chance of a shower in the east, clearing by early afternoon. The chance of a thunderstorm developing in the far west during the afternoon and evening. Winds south to southeasterly 15 to 20 km/h increasing to 30 km/h before tending east to southeasterly 15 to 25 km/h during the day. Overnight temperatures falling to around 19 with daytime temperatures reaching the low to mid 20s.
